ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There will circulate among them, ageless youths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Youths of never-ending bloom will pass round to them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: immortal youths shall go about them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Immortal boys will go around them (serving),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Round about them shall go youths never altering in age,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: immortal youths going round about them
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There wait on them immortal youths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they will be waited on by ageless youths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There shall go round Unto them youths ever-young.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will be waited upon by immortal youths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will be served by immortal boys,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (and there) shall wait on them immortal youths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Serving them will be immortalized youth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:17] They will be waited on by immortal youths, resembling young boys, never ageing;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (There wait on them) for service (immortal youths) servants; it is also said that these are the children of the disbelievers who are made servants for the people of Paradise. Another way of reading this verse is (There wait on them youths, and they are immortal): i.e. they will never die nor leave the Garden.
